messages.subject: Subject: Re: Where is the magic, here's some magic...
messages.msgSnippet: ... **You bet. There are plenty of Witches and Wizards around these parts. ... and such, the owl post sounds like a great start. **If you or your kids are into
messages.messageBody:
> weatherse@... writes:
> > Who said," there are no witches and wizards?" lol
> > Better look again!!!!


**You bet. There are plenty of Witches and Wizards around these parts.

> I have actually thought about doing something like that. Hogwarts classes
and such, the owl post sounds like a great start.

**If you or your kids are into the unschooling approach for learning <G>,
check out a delightful resource entitled "Grimoire for the Apprentice
Wizard" authored by Oberon Zell-Ravenheart, a true wizard, and the members
of the Grey Council, a group of elders Witches and Wizards all. One of the
absolute best books I've seen for introducing young (and also not so young)
folks to magick.

Blessed Be,
Lori
author of The Blessed Bee's "Pagan Homeschooling" column
